question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Input Validation] Can an attacker provide a Desc with variable_labels.len() that overflows when compared to label_values.len(), bypassing the validation check at line 29 and causing out-of-bounds access in label_pairs()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Memory Safety] Can an attacker pass extremely large label_values arrays that cause excessive memory allocation at line 28 when unwrap_or_default() creates empty default slice, potentially exhausting validator node memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Logic Error] Does the label validation at lines 29-31 properly handle the case where desc.variable_labels contains duplicate label names, allowing attackers to create ambiguous metrics that hide consensus failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Information Disclosure] Can malicious validators inject sensitive information (private keys, internal state) into counter values at line 36, which then get exposed through Prometheus endpoints, leaking critical validator data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Type Confusion] If label_pairs() returns labels in unexpected order, could the metric at lines 38-40 have mismatched label-value pairs that cause monitoring systems to report incorrect validator behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Panic Risk] What happens if label_pairs() panics during execution at line 33 - does this leave the ConstMetric struct in a partially initialized state that could be exploited in subsequent operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Float Precision] Can an attacker provide NaN or Infinity values for the counter value parameter at line 36, causing arithmetic errors in metrics aggregation that hide real consensus metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_counter()] [Error Message Leakage] Does the error at line 30 leak internal implementation details about descriptor structure that could help attackers understand the metrics system architecture? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Input Validation] Can an attacker exploit the identical validation logic at lines 54-57 as new_counter() to bypass label length checks through integer overflow, causing out-of-bounds array access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Type Confusion] Could the metric_type field at line 71 be set incorrectly if an attacker causes new_gauge() to succeed but with COUNTER type instead of GAUGE, breaking downstream monitoring systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Memory Exhaustion] Can an attacker repeatedly call new_gauge() with maximum-sized label arrays to exhaust validator memory through accumulated metric allocations at lines 59-66? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Typo Bug] Line 61 has 'guage' instead of 'gauge' - could this typo cause unexpected behavior in Prometheus serialization that breaks monitoring of validator health? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Float Manipulation] Can an attacker inject negative gauge values at line 62 that violate gauge semantics, causing monitoring dashboards to display incorrect validator performance metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: new_gauge()] [Clone Safety] Does cloning Desc at line 69 properly handle all internal references, or could desc mutation after new_gauge() returns corrupt the ConstMetric's internal state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Logic Error] Lines 94-99 create an empty Vec but immediately return it if total_labels is 0 - could this dead code path hide a bug where const_label_pairs should still be returned? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Integer Overflow] Can the addition at line 96 (desc.const_label_pairs.len() + desc.variable_labels.len()) overflow usize, causing the check at line 97 to incorrectly return empty labels? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Out of Bounds] At line 108, does the array access label_values[i] properly validate that i < label_values.len(), or could an attacker cause panic through carefully crafted desc.variable_labels? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Memory Safety] Could the enumerate() iterator at line 104 be manipulated to produce indices that exceed label_values bounds, causing undefined behavior during label_pair creation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Clone Performance] Lines 107-108 clone both label names and values - could an attacker provide extremely large strings that cause validator nodes to hang during metric collection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Sort Stability] Line 114 sorts labels without stable sort guarantee - could this cause non-deterministic label ordering across validators, leading to inconsistent metric aggregation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Extend Safety] Does extend_from_slice at line 113 validate that const_label_pairs doesn't contain duplicates of variable_labels, potentially creating ambiguous metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: label_pairs()] [Early Return] The early return at line 98 when label_values.is_empty() ignores const_label_pairs - could this hide important constant labels from metrics monitoring? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: desc()] [Reference Lifetime] Line 78 returns a reference to self.desc - could this reference outlive the ConstMetric if used unsafely, causing use-after-free in concurrent metric collection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-metrics-core/src/const_metric.rs] [Function: collect()] [Clone Cost] Line 87 clones self.metric for every collection - could an attacker trigger rapid collections to exhaust validator memory through accumulated clones? (Medium)
